questions.text: A 45-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with a concern about a "visible vein" in his right shoulder area. He reports that the vein becomes more pronounced during exercise or when lifting heavy objects. There is no associated pain, redness, or swelling. He denies any history of trauma to the area. On inspection of the right shoulder area reveals a prominent, non-pulsatile, linear structure running along the deltopectoral groove is seen. Which of the following structure is seen in this area
Who is often referred to as the "Father of modern Anatomy" due to his excellent works in the field of human anatomy?

In the anatomical arrangement of intermuscular spaces such as the cubital fossa, femoral triangle, anatomical snuff box, etc., what primarily forms the roof of these spaces? Skin Superficial fascia Subcutaneous fat, cutaneous nerves and vessels Deep fascia
Hilton's Law of Anatomy is most closely associated with which principle?

options.label: A
options.text: The relationship between muscle innervation and joint function.

options.label: B
options.text: The correlation between blood supply and organ health.

options.label: C
options.text: The connection between the nerve supplying a joint and the muscles moving the joint.

options.label: D
options.text: The relationship between the size of a muscle and its strength.

questions.correct_answer: C. The connection between the nerve supplying a joint and the muscles moving the joint.
questions.explanation: Ans. C. The connection between the nerve supplying a joint and the muscles moving the joint.

questions.text: Concept of “Anatomical position” is very essential for all kind of operative procedure and to understand and publish the articles. About anatomical position, which of the following statements is true?

options.label: A
options.text: The palms of the hands are facing posteriorly.

options.label: C
options.text: The feet are dorsiflexed at the ankles.

questions.correct_answer: B. The thumbs are oriented laterally.
questions.explanation: Ans. B. The thumbs are oriented laterally.

questions.text: A 28-year-old male presents with anterior knee pain that worsens with activities like running and jumping. On physical examination, there is tenderness and swelling over the front of the knee. Palpation reveals a small, round, bony prominence at the centre of the knee. The patient reports no recent trauma. You will put the involved bone in which of the following type
Where is the growth plate of cartilage in a long bone located?

options.label: B
options.text: Between the diaphysis and the epiphysis

questions.correct_answer: B. Between the diaphysis and the epiphysis
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Between the diaphysis and the epiphysis

questions.text: A 21-year-old patient Suyash came to OPD with history of fall on hand. Now he is having pain at hand region. X ray of patient is given. Which of the following joint has been shown in his X ray?
Which type of joint allows for rotational movement of the forearm, specifically allowing pronation and supination?
Which two joints are responsible for the nodding and shaking movements of the head, respectively?
questions.correct_answer: A. Atlanto-axial joint and atlanto-occipital joint
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Atlanto-axial joint and atlanto-occipital joint.

questions.text: What is the typical fiber arrangement of lumbrical muscles in the hand?

options.label: A
options.text: 1 st & 2 nd lumbricals – Unipennate, 3 rd & 4 th lumbricals - bipennate

options.label: B
options.text: 1 st & 2 nd lumbricals – biipennate, 3 rd & 4 th lumbricals - unipennate

options.label: C
options.text: 1 st & 3 rd lumbricals – biipennate, 2 nd & 4 th lumbricals - unipennate

options.label: D
options.text: 2 nd & 3 rd lumbricals – biipennate, 1 st & 4 th lumbricals - unipennate

questions.correct_answer: A. 1 st & 2 nd lumbricals – Unipennate, 3 rd & 4 th lumbricals - bipennate

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman presents to the emergency department after falling onto her outstretched hand. She complains of severe pain in her elbow. Physical examination reveals swelling and tenderness over the distal humerus. An X-ray confirms a supracondylar fracture. Upon further examination, the patient is unable to flex her thumb. Which nerve is most likely involved in this patient's presentation?

A surgeon is performing a dissection in the shoulder region and notes the structures passing through the clavipectoral fascia. Which of the following structures is known to pierce the clavipectoral fascia?
Which of the following statements is incorrect about the nerve involved in causing the deformity in the given image?

options.label: A
options.text: It passes deep to the flexor retinaculum

options.label: B
options.text: In the lower half of forearm it has a subfascial course

options.label: C
options.text: It enters the palm on the radial side of pisiform bone

options.label: D
options.text: It does not rest on the flexor carpi ulnaris

questions.correct_answer: A. It passes deep to the flexor retinaculum
questions.explanation: Ans. A. It passes deep to the flexor retinaculum

questions.text: A 60-year-old patient presents to the orthopedic clinic with complaints of progressive weakness in his right hand. The patient reports difficulty in fine movements of hand. Doctor performed a test over patient as shown in image. Which of the following statements is true about the given image?

options.label: A
options.text: The median nerve of the right hand is injured.

options.label: B
options.text: There is weakness of thenar muscles on the right side

options.label: C
options.text: The adductor pollicis of the right side is weak

options.label: D
options.text: The flexor muscles of the thumb of the right hand is weak

questions.correct_answer: C. The adductor pollicis of the right side is weak
questions.explanation: Ans. C. The adductor pollicis of the right side is weak

questions.text: A 75-year-old female presented to the medicine OPD with complaints of numbness over her little finger of the right hand. On examination, there was total loss of cutaneous sensation over the palmar and dorsal surface of the little finger of the right hand. Which of the following nerves is probably injured?

An eight-year-old male child managed to take his board game from the loft after standing on top of two chairs one over the other. But while trying to get down, he fell down from the topmost and experienced severe pain over his right hand, back & leg. The image given is his x-ray. Which of the following statements is true pertaining to the given case?

options.label: A
options.text: The scaphoid is the largest carpal bone

options.label: B
options.text: Trapezium is the largest carpal bone

options.label: C
options.text: Pisiform bone is not seen in this x-ray

options.label: D
options.text: Lunate is the smallest carpal bone

questions.correct_answer: C. Pisiform bone is not seen in this x-ray
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Pisiform bone is not seen in this x-ray

questions.text: All of the following statements are true about the structure labelled A in the given image except?

options.label: B
options.text: It originates from 3 rd , 4 th & 5 th ribs.

questions.correct_answer: D. It is retractor of scapula.
questions.explanation: Ans. D. It is retractor of scapula.

questions.text: A 47-year-old obese man felt a snap in his right lower leg while playing squash and couldn’t continue the game further. He reached the emergency department with complaints of acute severe pain in his right lower leg and heel. The physician confirmed a diagnosis of an acute right Achilles tendon rupture and the patient was immediately posted for open reparative surgery. Which of the following statements is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: It causes dorsiflexion of foot at the ankle joint

options.label: B
options.text: It is supplied by superficial peroneal nerve

options.label: C
options.text: It is the strongest tendon of the human body

options.label: D
options.text: Its inserts into the upper third of calcaneus

questions.correct_answer: C. It is the strongest tendon of the human body
questions.explanation: Ans. C. It is the strongest tendon of the human body

questions.text: A 17-year-old, who was going to represent his college football team in an intercollege sports event, after one of his practice sessions felt a vague pain over the inner side of his midfoot just above the longitudinal arch. His orthopedician also noted redness, tenderness and swelling in the area pointed out by the patient. The below image is the X-ray of the patient’s foot. Which of the following statements is true pertaining to the arrow pointed in the above image?

options.label: B
options.text: There is fracture of navicular bone

options.label: C
options.text: This bone is participating in lateral longitudinal arch

options.label: D
options.text: Supination & pronation occurs at this joint

questions.correct_answer: B. There is fracture of navicular bone
questions.explanation: Ans. B. There is fracture of navicular bone.

questions.text: A 22-year-old male athlete sustained an injury to his foot during one of his practice sessions. The given image is the x-ray of his foot. Which of the following statements is true pertaining to the given image?

options.label: A
options.text: It is fracture of first metatarsal base

options.label: B
options.text: It is a fracture of fifth metatarsal base

options.label: C
options.text: The tuberosity of the pointed bone in the above image is least vascular

options.label: D
options.text: Its metadiaphyseal region receives the insertion of peroneus tertius tendon

questions.correct_answer: B. It is a fracture of fifth metatarsal base
questions.explanation: Ans. B. It is a fracture of fifth metatarsal base.

questions.text: An 18-year-old female while driving her two wheeler accidentally collided with a car from the opposite side on her way to college. She failed to balance her vehicle and eventually fell down while the vehicle dropped over her left lower leg. X-ray revealed fracture of lower fibula and cast was applied. Few days after this, she developed pain and numbness over most of the dorsum of her left foot and had difficulty in turning her sole outwards. Which could be the most probable sight of nerve compression in this patient?

A 45-year-old male presents with a painful swelling in his right groin area. On physical examination, a bulge is noted at the mid inguinal point, which is located midway between the anterior superior iliac spine and the pubic symphysis. This finding is most suggestive of which of the following conditions?
Which structure is located at the mid inguinal point, a landmark situated midway between the anterior superior iliac spine and the pubic symphysis?

A medical resident is discussing knee joint mechanics with her attending physician. They focus on the process of locking (terminal knee extension) and unlocking (initiating knee flexion), which is crucial for efficient gait. Which muscle is primarily responsible for the unlocking mechanism of the knee joint?

In a clinical anatomy lecture, a medical instructor is discussing the movements of the foot. She asks the students to identify the joint responsible for inversion and eversion movements of the foot. Which joint allows these specific movements?

A fourth-year medical student is revising the anatomy of the lower limb and focuses on the compartments of the thigh and their nerve supply. Which of the following correctly matches the three main compartments of the thigh with their respective innervating nerves?

options.label: A
options.text: Anterior compartment: Femoral nerve; Medial compartment: Sciatic nerve; Posterior compartment: Obturator nerve

options.label: B
options.text: Anterior compartment: Sciatic nerve; Medial compartment: Femoral nerve; Posterior compartment: Obturator nerve

options.label: C
options.text: Anterior compartment: Femoral nerve; Medial compartment: Obturator nerve; Posterior compartment: Sciatic nerve

options.label: D
options.text: Anterior compartment: Obturator nerve; Medial compartment: Sciatic nerve; Posterior compartment: Femoral nerve

questions.correct_answer: C. Anterior compartment: Femoral nerve; Medial compartment: Obturator nerve; Posterior compartment: Sciatic nerve
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Anterior compartment: Femoral nerve; Medial compartment: Obturator nerve; Posterior compartment: Sciatic nerve

questions.text: During a practical session in anatomy, a group of medical students are asked to identify the nerve supply to the three compartments of the leg. Which of the following correctly associates each compartment of the leg with its respective innervating nerve?

options.label: A
options.text: Anterior compartment: Superficial peroneal nerve; Lateral compartment: Deep peroneal nerve; Posterior compartment: Tibial nerve

options.label: B
options.text: Anterior compartment: Deep peroneal nerve; Lateral compartment: Superficial peroneal nerve; Posterior compartment: Tibial nerve

options.label: C
options.text: Anterior compartment: Tibial nerve; Lateral compartment: Deep peroneal nerve; Posterior compartment: Superficial peroneal nerve

options.label: D
options.text: Anterior compartment: Superficial peroneal nerve; Lateral compartment: Tibial nerve; Posterior compartment: Deep peroneal nerve

questions.correct_answer: B. Anterior compartment: Deep peroneal nerve; Lateral compartment: Superficial peroneal nerve; Posterior compartment: Tibial nerve
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Anterior compartment: Deep peroneal nerve; Lateral compartment: Superficial peroneal nerve; Posterior compartment: Tibial nerve

questions.text: While discussing the actions of various thigh muscles, a group of medical residents focuses on the sartorius, the longest muscle in the human body. Which of the following best describes the action of the sartorius muscle?

options.label: A
options.text: Flexes, abducts, and laterally rotates the thigh at the hip joint; extends the knee

options.label: B
options.text: Extends, adducts, and medially rotates the thigh at the hip joint; flexes the knee

options.label: C
options.text: Flexes, abducts, and laterally rotates the thigh at the hip joint; flexes the knee

options.label: D
options.text: Extends, abducts, and laterally rotates the thigh at the hip joint; extends the knee

questions.correct_answer: C. Flexes, abducts, and laterally rotates the thigh at the hip joint; flexes the knee
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Flexes, abducts, and laterally rotates the thigh at the hip joint; flexes the knee

questions.text: During a surgical anatomy class, medical students are asked about the boundaries of the femoral triangle, an important region for vascular access and hernia repairs. Which of the following correctly identifies the boundaries of the femoral triangle?

options.label: A
options.text: Superior: Inguinal ligament; Lateral: Sartorius muscle; Medial: Adductor longus muscle

options.label: B
options.text: Superior: Inguinal ligament; Lateral: Adductor longus muscle; Medial: Sartorius muscle

options.label: C
options.text: Superior: Sartorius muscle; Lateral: Inguinal ligament; Medial: Adductor longus muscle

options.label: D
options.text: Superior: Adductor longus muscle; Lateral: Sartorius muscle; Medial: Inguinal ligament

questions.correct_answer: A. Superior: Inguinal ligament; Lateral: Sartorius muscle; Medial: Adductor longus muscle
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Superior: Inguinal ligament; Lateral: Sartorius muscle; Medial: Adductor longus muscle

questions.text: A group of medical students are learning about the femoral sheath and its contents during a clinical skills session. They are asked to identify the structures contained within the femoral sheath. Which of the following options correctly lists the contents of the femoral sheath?

options.label: A
options.text: Femoral artery, femoral vein, femoral nerve

options.label: B
options.text: Femoral artery, femoral vein, deep inguinal lymph nodes

options.label: C
options.text: Femoral artery, femoral nerve, lymphatic vessels

options.label: D
options.text: Femoral vein, femoral nerve, lymphatic vessels

questions.correct_answer: B. Femoral artery, femoral vein, deep inguinal lymph nodes
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Femoral artery, femoral vein, deep inguinal lymph nodes

questions.text: A medical student is learning about the vascular examination of the lower limbs. The student is asked to identify the sites where pulsations of the major arteries of the lower limb can be palpated. Which of the following options correctly pairs the arteries with their palpation sites?

options.label: A
options.text: Femoral artery: Groin; Popliteal artery: Posterior knee; Dorsalis pedis artery: Dorsum of foot

options.label: B
options.text: Femoral artery: Mid-thigh; Posterior tibial artery: Anterior ankle; Dorsalis pedis artery: Lateral malleolus

options.label: C
options.text: Femoral artery: Inguinal ligament; Popliteal artery: Anterior knee; Posterior tibial artery: Medial malleolus

options.label: D
options.text: Femoral artery: Anterior thigh; Popliteal artery: Lateral knee; Dorsalis pedis artery: Heel

questions.correct_answer: A. Femoral artery: Groin; Popliteal artery: Posterior knee; Dorsalis pedis artery: Dorsum of foot
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Femoral artery: Groin; Popliteal artery: Posterior knee; Dorsalis pedis artery: Dorsum of foot

questions.text: A group of medical residents is discussing the formation of major nerves of the lower limb. They focus on the sciatic nerve, the largest nerve in the human body. Which of the following options correctly describes the formation of the sciatic nerve?

options.label: A
options.text: Formed by the union of L4-S3 nerve roots

options.label: B
options.text: Formed by the union of L2-L4 nerve roots

options.label: C
options.text: Formed by the union of L5-S2 nerve roots

options.label: D
options.text: Formed by the union of L4-S2 nerve roots

questions.correct_answer: A. Formed by the union of L4-S3 nerve roots
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Formed by the union of L4-S3 nerve roots

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman presents with aching pain and swelling in her left leg, which worsens by the end of the day and improves with leg elevation. Physical examination reveals dilated, tortuous superficial veins in her left medial thigh. Doppler ultrasound confirms venous reflux. Which vein is most likely involved in this patient's condition?

A 55-year-old woman presents with a complaint of unsteady gait. During examination, when asked to stand on her right leg, her left hip drops. This finding is not observed when she stands on her left leg. This clinical sign indicates weakness in which of the following muscles?

A 28-year-old professional football player presents with difficulty in kicking a ball. He reports a recent history of decreased strength during knee extension. Additionally, in a separate case, a child with a history of poliomyelitis is observed using his hand to push against his knee to assist in walking. Which muscle group is primarily responsible for knee extension and is likely affected in both cases?

A 50-year-old man with a sedentary lifestyle presents with chronic lower extremity edema. On examination, his calf muscles appear underdeveloped. The physician explains the importance of a particular lower limb muscle in venous blood return from the lower extremities. Which muscle is often referred to as the "peripheral heart" due to its role in facilitating venous return?

Patient presented with a sagging face, asymmetrical smile, facial muscle tone with drooping of left angle of mouth, eyelid with drooping corners and inability to blow properly. Which Nerve is involved in this case?

A 45-year-old male presented with a 2-week history of pain in the left side of the neck and noted his tongue pulled to the left side making eating, drinking and speaking difficult two months back he had undergone carotid endarterectomy. On examination, the only neurological abnormality noted was the deviation of the tongue as shown in below image with associated wasting of the left half of the tongue. Nerve injured is:
A 28-year-old male sustained head injury due to fall from his bike. CT brain showed features as shown in image. The blood vessel injured is:
A 57-year-old man underwent parotidectomy following which he complained that there was loss of sensation while shaving. Which nerve is affected most?
A patient presented with painful vesicular eruptions as shown in image. Which division of trigeminal nerve is involved?
All of the following statements are incorrect about the highlighted area in the given image except?

options.label: A
options.text: It is located on the dorsal aspect of hand and becomes visible when the thumb is fully abducted adducted

options.label: B
options.text: Floor is formed by styloid process of radius, base of first metacarpal bone

options.label: C
options.text: Medially by tendon of extensor pollicis brevis

options.label: D
options.text: Laterally by extensor carpi radialis longus

questions.correct_answer: B. Floor is formed by styloid process of radius, base of first metacarpal bone
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Floor is formed by styloid process of radius, base of first metacarpal bone

questions.text: A 55-year-old woman whose impacted left lower wisdom tooth was surgically removed. The operation lasted about an hour, and the dental surgeon suspected that some nerves might have been bruised during the operation. The patient presented with loss of sensation in the gums of her lower jaw, and her mouth was slightly dry. On examination the taste sensation in the tongue was diminished in the anterior two-thirds but it was normal in the posterior portion. Which among the following nerves has been injured in this patient?

A 53-year-old male rock climber spent the day climbing outdoors with a partner. They hiked to the base of the climb carrying their gear in backpacks. After a day of climbing, they hurried to return to their vehicle because of the imminent loss of daylight. He carried his climbing gear slung over his shoulder. As he was approaching the trailhead, he noted some soreness in his right neck area. After hiking 4 hours back to his vehicle, while carrying approximately 20 pounds of gear in this manner, he realized he was unable to shrug his right shoulder. He reports being incapable of contracting his trapezius or being able to fully elevate the affected arm for3 days. As there was no improvement, he sought medical advice. Which of the following nerves has been injured in the above scenario?

A 56-year-old man as shown in image presents with weakness in his hand. He reports difficulty extending his wrist and fingers and a decreased sensation on the back of his hand. These symptoms have progressively worsened over the past few weeks. Which of the following structures is most likely affected in this patient?

A 65-year-old office worker complains of persistent wrist pain and difficulty performing repetitive tasks on a computer keyboard. Physical examination reveals tenderness at the wrist joint and decreased range of motion, particularly during wrist flexion and extension. Radiographic evaluation shows evidence of degenerative changes in the joint space. Which of the following bones is NOT directly involved in the formation of the wrist joint?

A 65-year-old patient with a history of hypertension and diabetes is admitted to the hospital with complaints of weakness in the hand and difficulty holding objects. The patient's medical history includes a recent cerebrovascular accident (CVA). A "test" is performed as shown in image as part of the neurological examination. Which of the following muscle groups is primarily assessed with this test to check for motor function in the hand?
Match the following:
The marked structure contains:
Which nerve is thickened in the following image of a patient with Hansen's disease?
Injury of which of the following nerve causes of drooping of shoulder?
Identify the nerve passing through Dorello’s canal:
Which of the following structure, when bilaterally ablated, leads to an inability to form long-term memories?
Identify the type of fibre marked in the given diagram:
Which of the following is not a likely consequence of occlusion of the artery supplying the indicated area?
Which area of the cerebrum, if affected, would result in a patient knowing what they want to speak but being unable to do so?
Which of the following is incorrectly marked?
The marked cells inhibits the deep cerebellar nuclei. Identify the cell:
Which of the following speech disorders is caused by the injury of the structure shown in the histological image?
In following image, deficient synthesis of neurotransmitter may lead to Parkinson disease?
Superior, inferior & facial colliculus are indicated respectively as?
Identify the vertebra?
Which is medial branch of external carotid artery?
Eye of the hand is?
Key muscle of pectoral region & gluteal region are respectively?
Graveyard of ulnar nerve is?
Identify the position of fasciculus gracilis & fasciculus cuneatus in following image?
Identify the correct options with indicated structures?

options.label: A
options.text: A-anterior cerebral artery, B-ICA, C-infundibulum, D-Posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F-IV nerve

options.label: B
options.text: A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F- IV nerve

options.label: C
options.text: A-anterior cerebral artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-IV nerve, F- V nerve

options.label: D
options.text: A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F- V nerve

questions.correct_answer: B. A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F- IV nerve
questions.explanation: Ans. B. A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F- IV nerve

questions.text: Which of the following structure projects into which thalamic nucleus:
Nucleus ambiguous & Nucleus tractus solitareus are common cranial nerve nuclei of

A 45-year-old female patient presents to the clinic with complaints of recurrent episodes of fatigue, dizziness, and syncope, especially during physical activity. On examination, her blood pressure is 100/70 mm Hg, and a systolic murmur is heard along the left sternal border. An echocardiogram reveals severe aortic stenosis. Right coronary artery origin part was affected. Where does the right coronary artery originate from?
Which chamber of the heart forms the base of the heart?

A 45-year-old male patient presents with recurrent episodes of palpitations and dizziness. An echocardiogram reveals an enlarged right atrium and evidence of a right-to-left shunt. During the cardiac catheterization procedure, the cardiologist observes a valve-like structure within the right atrium. Which of the following structures guards the opening of the coronary sinus and may be contributing to the patient's symptoms?

A 3-week-old male infant is brought to the pediatric clinic by his parents due to persistent respiratory distress and feeding difficulties since birth. The baby appears to have labored breathing, and the parents report that he frequently vomits after feeds. On physical examination, the infant is tachypneic with retractions and decreased breath sounds on the left side. A chest X-ray shows abdominal contents in the left thoracic cavity, confirming the diagnosis of a diaphragmatic hernia. Which of the following structure passes through the marked opening in the given image?
Which of the following structures passes through the aortic opening of the diaphragm?

A 65-year-old patient presents with dysphagia and a sensation of food getting stuck in the throat. On examination, the clinician measures the distance from the patient's central incisor to the cricopharyngeal constrictor and finds it to be:

A 64-year-old male with complaints of weight loss, nausea, vague epigastric pain for the past 6 months was suggested by his family physician to have a CT scan abdomen. Abdominal CT showed a large irregular mass extending posteriorly from the greater curvature of the stomach, impinging on the splenic artery and vein as they pass below. Tissue supplied by which of the following arteries would most likely be affected by compression of the splenic artery?
Portal vein is formed at which vertebral level
Intercostobrachial nerve is
Pringle’s manuvear is performed through Epiploic foramen at which vertebral level
Dorsal part of ventral mesogastrium gives rise to
Ventral part of dorsal mesogastrium gives rise to
Fascia related to penis, scrotum & perineum are

options.label: A
options.text: Buck’s fascia, Dorto’s fascia, Colle’s fascia

options.label: B
options.text: Dorto’s fascia, Colle’s fascia, Buck’s fascia

options.label: C
options.text: Buck’s fascia, Colle’s fascia, Dorto’s fascia

options.label: D
options.text: Colle’s fascia, Dorto’s fascia, Buck’s fascia

questions.correct_answer: A. Buck’s fascia, Dorto’s fascia, Colle’s fascia
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Buck’s fascia, Dorto’s fascia, Colle’s fascia

questions.text: A 55-year-old male with a history of chronic pelvic pain and urinary frequency undergoes diagnostic imaging to investigate the cause of his symptoms. The imaging study focuses on the pelvic vasculature to identify any abnormalities that might explain his clinical presentation. Understanding the anatomy of the internal iliac artery and its branches is crucial for interpreting the imaging findings. Which of the following branches of the internal iliac artery is typically NOT an anterior branch and therefore less likely to be directly involved in the patient's pelvic symptoms?
Where in the body is the tissue shown in the image typically found?

A 48-year-old man with a history alcohol abuse presents to your clinic complaining of fatigue and abdominal discomfort. Biopsy of an organ was done which is showing histology pattern as a shown in image. In this organ stellate cells of von Kupffer, located in the sinusoids and involved in the immune response, was typically found. Identify this organ
Identify the histological slide given below

A 45-year-old man presents to the clinic with difficulty in speaking and swallowing. He reports that these symptoms have been progressively worsening over the past six months. Physical examination reveals atrophy and weakness of the tongue muscles. There is no sensory loss, and other cranial nerve functions are intact. His past medical history is significant for a long-standing diagnosis of a neurodegenerative disorder. Which of the following is the embryological origin of the affected muscle?

A 5-year-old boy is brought to the pediatrician by his parents who are concerned about his frequent episodes of sore throat and difficulty swallowing. His medical history reveals recurrent streptococcal throat infections. Examination reveals enlarged tonsils, which nearly obstruct the oropharyngeal passage. The tonsils are erythematous with white exudates. The development of these enlarged tonsils is primarily associated with which of the following embryonic structures?
Fate of left 6 th aortic arch:
The reason for the long left recurrent laryngeal is due to the persistence of which arch artery?

A 29-year-old woman comes to your office for a prenatal consultation. She is at her 8 th week of pregnancy and is concerned about the risk of neural tube defects in her baby. You discuss the development of the neural tube and inform her about the critical period for its closure. By which day after conception does the caudal end of the neural tube typically close?

A 33-year-old woman presents to your clinic with her partner for a consultation on difficulty conceiving. As part of the fertility workup, you discuss the process of fertilization and the importance of the fallopian tubes in this process. You explain that fertilization typically occurs in a specific part of the fallopian tube. Which part of the fallopian tube is most commonly the site of fertilization?

A 6-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with intermittent cramping abdominal pain and bloody stools for the past two days. He has no significant past medical history. On examination, he is afebrile, and his abdomen is soft with mild tenderness in the right lower quadrant. No masses are palpable, and the rest of the examination is unremarkable. An ultrasound of the abdomen shows a small outpouching in the distal ileum which is remnant of vitello intestinal duct. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is correct sequence of functional column of cranial nerve nuclei from medial to lateral side

options.label: A
options.text: GSE → BA → GVE → GVA → BE → GSA → SSA

options.label: B
options.text: GSE → BA → GVA → GVE → BE → GSA → SSA

options.label: C
options.text: GSE → BE → GVE → GSA → BE → GVA → SSA

options.label: D
options.text: GSE → BE → GVE → GVA → BA → GSA → SSA

questions.correct_answer: D. GSE → BE → GVE → GVA → BA → GSA → SSA

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman is seen in the fertility clinic due to difficulty conceiving for the past two years. During her evaluation, the physician discusses various aspects of reproductive biology. She explains the origin of germ cells, which are crucial for fertility. From which of the following embryonic structures are germ cells derived?
Which of the following is not a mesoderm derivative?
Correct sequence of mesoderm from lateral to medial is

options.label: A
options.text: Paraxial mesoderm → Intermediate mesoderm → Lateral plate mesoderm

options.label: B
options.text: Paraxial mesoderm → Lateral plate mesoderm → Intermediate mesoderm

options.label: C
options.text: Lateral plate mesoderm → Intermediate mesoderm → Paraxial mesoderm

options.label: D
options.text: Lateral plate mesoderm → Paraxial mesoderm → Intermediate mesoderm

questions.correct_answer: C. Lateral plate mesoderm → Intermediate mesoderm → Paraxial mesoderm
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Lateral plate mesoderm→Intermediate mesoderm→Paraxial mesoderm

questions.text: During embryonic development, the aortic arches play a crucial role in forming the major arteries of the head and neck region. The third aortic arch contributes to the formation of which important blood vessel?
